headline: Job Description and Real Meaning
description:
I came across a job definition today in my LinkedIn job feed. This is kind of a startup job, but the descriptions appear to be very thinly veiled from their real intentions. The lines with * are my interpretations.

- Those who use the word "impossible" are asked not to disturb those who try * you will be asked to do the impossible and crazy stuff, but don't complain - We don’t reinvent the wheel, others have already done it before us, so we reuse as much as possible * you should copy code from random github repos and complete work in 5 mins - Work smart, not hard * if you work overtime, its your fault. don't expect compensation - Work should always be engaging * you should immerse yourself full time in work - We hate silos and break them with full transparency and communication * no clear role boundary. you need to do everything - We are not building tools but solutions * you are responsible for overall project or solution, thugh its not your role - We continuously improve by removing waste * you can be fired any time - We put our users first and generate value for them before all * you won't be paid until our users are happy and pay us - We anticipate change and are adaptive * We don't know what we are doing, but don't complain - We focus on attention to detail and precision in everything we do * You don't have scope for mistakes and corrections
description_zh-Hans:
我今天在我的LinkedIn工作反馈中看到了一个工作定义。这算是一个初创企业的工作，但描述中似乎对其真实意图有很薄的掩饰。带*的那几行是我的解释。

- 使用"不可能"这个词的人被要求不要打扰那些尝试的人 *你将被要求做不可能和疯狂的事情，但不要抱怨。 - 我们不会重新发明轮子，别人已经在我们之前做过了，所以我们尽可能地重复使用 * 你应该从随机的github仓库复制代码并在5分钟内完成工作 - 聪明地工作，而不是努力工作 * 如果你加班，那是你的错，不要指望得到补偿 - 工作应该始终具有吸引力 * 你应该全身心地沉浸在工作中 - 我们讨厌筒子楼，并以充分的透明度和沟通来打破它们。 *没有明确的角色界限。你需要做任何事情 - 我们不是在构建工具，而是在构建解决方案 *你要对整个项目或解决方案负责，尽管它不是你的角色 - 我们通过消除浪费持续改进 *你可以在任何时候被解雇 - 我们把用户放在第一位，并为他们创造价值。 * 在我们的用户满意并向我们付款之前，你不会得到报酬。 - 我们预测变化并具有适应性 *我们不知道自己在做什么，但不抱怨 - 我们专注于关注细节，做任何事情都要精确 * 你没有犯错和改正的余地
